required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Urinary Diversion (Transurethral/Suprapubic) After Radical Prostatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Study Comparing Urinary Diversion by Suprapubic Catheter With Transurethral Catheter in Patients After Radical Prostatectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to show the technical feasibility of the suprapubic urinary diversion after endoscopic extraperitoneal radical prostatectomy (EERPE) and has a greater comfort for the patients with at least the same catheter complication rate in comparison to the urethral urinary diversion.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients are randomized 1:1 in the different arms Recording of QoL measured by visual analogue ( pain )scale,EORTC QlQ -C 30 and QLQ - PR 25 questionnaires, incontinence rate, complication rate regarding insufficiency and strictures of vesicourethral anastomoses and urinary tract infection; demand of re-catheterization due to urinary retention and demand of antispasmodics

primary_outcome.measure: Superiority of suprapubic catheter after EERPE
primary_outcome.description: Superiority of suprapubic catheter versus transurethral catheter regarding QoL /Patient comfort

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of QoL in both arms measured by visual analogue (pain) scale
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of QoL in both arms measured by visual analogue (pain) scale, EORTC QlQ -C 30 and QLQ - PR 25 questionnaires, incontinence rate, complication rate regarding insufficiency and strictures of vesicourethral anastomoses and urinary tract infection; demand of re-catheterization due to urinary retention and demand of antispasmodics.

arm_group.description: Recording of QoL measured by visual analogue ( pain )scale,EORTC QlQ -C 30 and QLQ - PR 25 questionnaires, incontinence rate, complication rate regarding insufficiency and strictures of vesicourethral anastomoses and urinary tract infection; demand of re-catheterization due to urinary retention and demand of antispasmodics

Recording of QoL measured by visual analogue ( pain )scale,EORTC QlQ -C 30 and QLQ - PR 25 questionnaires, incontinence rate, complication rate regarding insufficiency and strictures of vesicourethral anastomoses and urinary tract infection; demand of re-catheterization due to urinary retention and demand of antispasmodics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adenocarcinoma of the prostate,
- Subjects treated by conventional or robotic assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy
- Be willing/able to adhere to follow up visits
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects treated by retropubic or perineal prostatectomy Subjects with known bladder cancer
- Contraindications for anticholinergic drugs
- Waist measurement > 100 cm
- No written informed consent
- Age < 18 years
- Subjects with known narrow-angle glaucoma
